item.title: Choosing a Running Shoe
item.description: Five big factors to consider: Terrain Cushioning Gait Support Size Mileage Terrain Road-running shoes are generally light, flexible and even cushioning with flatter and smoother soles. Trail-running shoes have bigger lugs to grip on unstable terrain, stronger underfoot and generally stiffer to handle uneven surfaces. Cross-training shoes are thiner and simpler, to be used indoors for workouts and balance activities. Cushioning The two main aspects are firmness and thickness of the foam between your feet and the ground.

item.title: Runner's Knee
item.description: Runner’s Knee is an umbrella term for several conditions that can cause discomfort or pain around the knee cap or the patella region. Any activity that stresses the knee joint can cause. A dull or aching feeling above, below or behind the knee cap. May experience swelling, cracking, popping or grinding sensation. Irritation of the soft tissue or lining of the knee, worn or torn cartillage or strained tendons. How to prevent it?

item.title: Training Plan - Walker
item.description: This is a training plan for absolute starters or those recovering from injury. The focus is on getting the joints ready for higher intensity workouts as safely as possible. It’s much better to progress slowly and surely than to risk having to start all over again. Stretch a lot. Kneeling hip flexor and quad stretch Get into a kneeling lunge position, with one knee on the flor and the other bent 90 degrees in front of you.
